author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> So I'm running up against the following error with SIWE on the `sequencer.ceremony.ethereum.org` deployment: `AuthErrorPayload - CouldNotExtractUserData could not extract user data from auth server`.

the logs are clean on the server. any ideas what could be the culprit?

author: kevaundray
content: Are you using a brand new Ethereum account?

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> yes, but i have minimum nonce set to 0

author: kevaundray
content: I think I opened an issue for this a while back, you might need to disable the rpc call that tries to query what the nonce is

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> hmm, ok will re-try with account with higher nonce

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> hmm so i increased the `eth_min_nonce` and tried with an account with a high nonce and still the same error

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> would this error occur if the eth rpc endpoint was poorly configured?

author: arnaucube
content: question, where can be found the Sequencer server code? (to check the current API methods, and to run it locally for testing)

author: arnaucube
content: managed to add a contribution to the deployed sequencer (kzg-ceremony-sequencer-dev.fly.dev) authenticating with the github auth method, contributing to the ceremony from the custom go impl (https://github.com/arnaucube/eth-kzg-ceremony-alt)
